description: Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek βουλευτήριον (bouleutḗrion).

entries.meaning: (architecture, historical) A building in Ancient Greece, housing the boule (council of citizens), where public affairs were discussed.
examples: The "Old Bouleuterion", whether it was built before or after the Persian sack of Athens,3 certainly antedates the New Bouleuterion.
